What happened :

I had a vessel landed on kerbin, on a quite steep slope.

I had the kerbal go all the way up the Mk1 Commandpod ladder, and fall of it to the ground.

Where I thought it would stick to the grounf and stand back up, it did slide down quite fast (to the point it stretched a bit) and stopped at the end of this rare slippery slope.

When I saw it stopped ragdolling, i pushed the W key to have it stand up, but then, the screen went black, UI was good, except for the altitude radar that displayes blank spaces.

The debug menu told that

[Log]: Look rotation viewing vector is zero
.

THe log is here : https://www.dropbox.com/s/14orkw7y8y4bbdf/KSP.log?dl=0

There is a lor of

dest.radius>=0.0f
to scroll past because I was quite slow at reacting to whatever happened.

Thanks for the hard work, I hope this will help make the game better.

Update :

The kerbal was missing in action (as written in the log : no vessel assigned, yet not dead), and when I deleted the ship, (clicking on "terminate" in the tracking station) it seems that the Kerbal was set to Killed.
